tuv.seg: Grant scheme to replace lead pipes and fittings
Scéim deontais chun píobáin agus feistis luaidhe a dheisiú
A new grant scheme has been set up to help low-income households with the cost of replacing lead piping in their homes
Socraíodh scéim deontais nua chun cabhrú le teaghlaigh ísealioncaim íoc as an gcostas a bhíonn ar phíoblach luaidhe ina dtithe a réiteach
The scheme is being introduced under the Domestic Lead Remediation (Financial Assistance) Regulations 2016 (pdf)
Tá an scéim á tabhairt isteach faoi na Rialacháin um Dheisiú Luaidhe (Cúnamh Airgeadais), 2016 (pdf)
More details of the scheme are on environ.ie, along with a combined information note and application form (pdf)
Tá níos mó sonraí faoin scéim ar environ.ie, anuas ar nóta faisnéise agus foirm iarratais i dteannta a chéile (pdf)
You must own the dwelling and live in it as your principal private residence
Ní mór go bhfuil an áit chónaithe faoi d’úinéireacht agus caithfidh tú cónaí ann mar d’áit chónaithe phríomha
The lead pipes and fittings being replaced must form part of a system that carries water for preparing food or drinks or for direct human consumption
Ní mór go gcruthaíonn na píobáin agus na feistis luaidhe atá á n-ionadú cuid de chóras a iompraíonn uisce chun bia nó deochanna a ullmhú nó a iompraíonn uisce atá le hól ag daoine
You must get the remedial work done before applying for the grant
Ní mór go ndéantar an obair dheisiúcháin sula ndéanann tú iarratas ar an deontas
Any contractor that you use must give you a current tax clearance certificate
Ní mór go dtugann aon chonraitheoir a úsáideann tú deimhniú reatha imréitigh cánach duit
They must provide itemised receipts, detailing the work carried out and the associated costs
Caithfidh siad fáltais mhiondealaithe a sholáthar, ina sonraítear an obair faoinar tugadh agus na costais ghaolmhara
They must also certify in writing that any materials used, including pipes and fittings, are of appropriate quality and that a proper standard of workmanship has been applied

Chomh maith leis sin, caithfidh siad a dheimhniú, i scríbhinn, go mbaineann aon ábhair a úsáidtear, píobáin agus feistis san áireamh, an cháilíocht chuí amach agus gur cuireadh caighdeán ceart saoirseachta i bhfeidhm
You will need to enclose these certificates and receipts with your application for the grant
Beidh ort na deimhnithe agus na fáltais seo a chur faoi iamh le d’iarratas ar an deontas
You must also provide evidence of a risk of lead contamination in your home
Caithfidh tú fianaise a sholáthar, chomh maith, i leith riosca i leith éilliú luaidhe i do theach
Acceptable evidence is either:
I measc na fianaise atá inghlactha, tá an méid a leanas:
• A notification from your water supplier advising that your water system is likely to contain lead pipes and fittings or
• Foirm fógra ó do sholáthraí uisce a chuireann in iúl gur dóchúil go gcuimseofar i do chóras uisce píobáin agus feistis luaidhe nó
• A laboratory certificate issued within the previous 6 months, showing a parametric value for lead in your water supply that is over the statutory limit
• Deimhniú saotharlainne a eisíodh le 6 mhí anuas, a léiríonn luach paraiméadrach le haghaidh luaidhe i do sholáthar uisce a sháraíonn an teorainn reachtúil
The issuing laboratory must be accredited by the Irish National Accreditation Board (INAB) for testing for lead in drinking water
Ní mór go mbíonn an tsaotharlann eisithe creidiúnaithe ag Bord Náisiúnta na hÉireann um Chreidiúnú (INAB) chun tástáil a dhéanamh do luaidhe in uisce óil
The grant is means-tested – see ‘Rates’ below
Déantar tástáil mhaoine ar an deontas – féach ‘Rátaí’ thíos
You will have to provide evidence of your household income when applying
Beidh ort fianaise a sholáthar i leith ioncam do theaghlaigh nuair a dhéanann tú iarratas
This is calculated as your gross taxable income in the previous tax year, together with that of your spouse or partner
Ríomhtar seo mar d’ollioncam inchánach sa bhliain chánach roimhe seo, anuas ar ollioncam inchánach do chéile nó do pháirtneára
The required evidence is:
Is í an fhianaise a theastaíonn:
• For employees paying tax under PAYE, a balancing statement (P21) or equivalent document from Revenue
• I dtaobh fostaithe a íocann cáin faoi ÍMAT, ráiteas comhardaithe nó cáipéis chomhionann ó na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
• For self-employed people, a notice of income tax assessment or equivalent document from Revenue
• I dtaobh daoine féinfhostaithe, fógra i leith measúnú ar cháin ioncaim nó cáipéis chomhionann ó na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
• For people on social welfare payments, a statement of income from the Department of Social Protection
• I dtaobh daoine a bhfuil íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh á bhfáil acu, ráiteas ioncaim ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí
The level of grant is based on the household’s gross annual income in the previous tax year, as set out in the table below
Tá an leibhéal deontais bunaithe ar ollioncam bliantúil an teaghlaigh sa bhliain chánach roimhe seo, faoi mar a leagtar amach sa tábla thíos
│Household income per │Percentage of approved costs │Maximum grant │ │year │available │payable │
│Ioncam teaghlaigh sa bhliain │Céatadán na gcostas faofa atá ar fáil │An deontas uasta atá iníoctha │
│Over €75,000 │No grant │No grant │
│Os cionn €75,000 │Deontas ar bith │Deontas ar bith │
Complete the application form (pdf) as outlined in the accompanying information notes, and send it, along with the required documentation, to your local authority
Comhlánaigh an fhoirm iarratais (pdf), faoi mar a dtugtar cuntas air sna nótaí faisnéise a ghabhann leis seo, agus seol ar aghaidh í, anuas ar an gcáipéisíocht riachtanach, chuig d’údarás áitiúil

Lead can be present in drinking water, as lead piping, lead solder and lead-lined water tanks were commonly used in plumbing up to and including the 1970s, so some people may still be getting water through these older plumbing systems

Féadfaidh luaidhe a bheith in uisce óil, mar gheall gur baineadh úsáid choiteann as píobáin luaidhe, sádar luaidhe agus umair uisce a bhí líneáilte le luaidhe sa phluiméireacht a fhad leis an 1970idí, agus an tráth sin san áireamh
Lead is a danger to health, especially for young children, pregnant women and babies fed on formula, so water for drinking and cooking should contain as little lead as possible
D’fhéadfadh uisce a bheith á soláthar go fóill do roinnt daoine trí na córais níos sine phluiméireachta seo, ar an ábhar sin
The legal level of lead in drinking water is 10 micrograms per litre
Is é an leibhéal dlíthiúil luaidhe in uisce óil 10 micreagram in aghaidh an lítir
The HSE has published a joint position paper on lead in drinking water (pdf) with the EPA, along with a set of FAQs
D’fhoilsigh FSS comh-staidpháipéar ar luaidhe in uisce óil (pdf) i dteannta an GCC, anuas ar shraith ceisteanna coitianta
A national strategy to reduce lead exposure has been published and Irish Water is preparing a national mitigation plan
Foilsíodh straitéis náisiúnta chun nochtadh do luaidhe a laghdú agus tá plean náisiúnta maolaithe á ullmhú ag Uisce Éireann
